intro: Oxydectes lasiantha, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by fluffy, white bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to arid environments. Oxydectes lasiantha is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value.
